sen.e: Arisuke SHIJO was a "kuge" (court noble) serving "Yoshino Imperial Court" (the Southern Court) in "Nanbokucho Period" (the Period of the Northern and Southern Courts), whose birth & death year is unknown.

sen.j: 1337年（延元2年/建武 (日本)4年）伊予国司として任国に赴いた。
sen.e: In 1337, he went to Iyo Province as the "Kokushi."

sen.j: 以降、「大将」（国大将のことか）として同国宇和荘に入ったり、忽那島に渡って合戦の指揮をする（「忽那一族軍忠次第」）など伊予南朝方の勢力拡大に努めた。
sen.e: Thereafter, he endeavored to expand the influence of the Southern Court in Iyo Province by, the ancient document "Kutsuna-ichizoku gunchushidai" says, entering "Uwa no sho" (Manor Uwa) as "Taisho" (meaning a great provincial general, perhaps) or by going to (& commanding the battle in) Kutsuna-jima Island.

Thereafter, he endeavored to expand the influence of the Southern Court in Iyo Province by, the ancient document "Kutsuna-ichizoku gunchushidai" says, entering "Uwa no sho" (Manor Uwa) as "Taisho" (meaning a great provincial general, perhaps) or by going to (and commanding the battle in) Kutsuna-jima Island.

Thereafter, he endeavored to expand the influence of the Southern Court in Iyo Province by, the ancient document 'Kutsuna Ichizoku gunchu shidai' (records of the meritorious war service of the Kutsuna family in Kutsuna-jima Island) says, entering Uwa no sho (Manor Uwa) in the same province as 'Taisho' (meaning a great provincial general, perhaps) or by going to and commanding the battle in Kutsuna-jima Island.

sen.j: 1343年（興国4年/康永2年）11月8日 (旧暦)、忽那義範に伊予名越城の「後措」を命じたのを最後に、以後消息不明。
sen.e: On November 8, 1343 (by the lunar calendar), he ordered Yoshinori KUTSUNA to take "Koso" (the postwar measures) of Iyo-Nagoshi Castle, and after that he went missing.
